-1002674864764.html:
A priest of the UOC is being tried in the Cherkasy region for justifying the war

On May 30, in the city of Smila, Cherkasy region, a trial began against the rector of the Church of the Intercession of the Mother of God in the village of Melnikivka, who is accused of justifying Russian aggression against Ukraine.

The reason for the accusation was the personal correspondence found on his phone, in which, according to the prosecutor, there are statements in support of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation. Among the quoted messages:

"The Russian soldier liberated the world from fascism, Nazism and other filth. I am immensely grateful to God that I am a Russian."

The priest is charged under Part 2 of Article 436-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine - up to 8 years in prison. He partially admitted his guilt. The court ordered him to be under round-the-clock house arrest until July 29. The next hearing is scheduled for June 23.

üì∑: Suspilne Cherkasy

The AUCECB reported new trials of conscientious objectors in Ukraine

The Ukrainian department of advocacy of the AUCECB published a notice about upcoming court proceedings against believers who refused mobilization on religious grounds. They are all accused under Article 336 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (evasion of conscription in a special period), and in one case also under Article 402 (disobedience to a commander).

Scheduled dates:

‚Äî June 4 ‚Äî Vadim Edinak (Zhytomyr), Alexander Kuchinsky (Vinnytsia region);
‚Äî June 11 ‚Äî Konstantin Chovan (Kharkiv region);
‚Äî June 16 ‚Äî Alexey Poznyak (Odesa region);
‚Äî date unknown yet ‚Äî Iosif Oros (Chernivtsi region), the case has been postponed.

According to the church, the brothers did not evade civil duty, but only refused to take up arms, following their religious beliefs.

#ukraine #baptists #conscientious_objectors Source channel: test_source

There is a heightened alert status around the Radost-Skorbyashchenskiy parish in Minsk.

The entire roadside from the turn from Pritytskogo Street to Yefrosinii Polotskoy Street and up to the Yestoday sports club is completely cleared of cars. Parking lots are blocked off, and "No Stopping" signs have been installed. The parish gates are closed, and a police car is on duty.

Attempts by believers to enter the territory are accompanied by warnings: they are not allowed to linger for long. All - parishioners, staff and clergy - are informed that they will soon have to leave the territory. An inspection of the temple complex premises is expected in connection with the preparation for the visit of Patriarch Kirill, which is expected after 19:00.

Tomorrow is the memory day of St. Euphrosyne of Polotsk, and for the Radost-Skorbyashchenskiy parish this is a special day: one of the temples of the complex is consecrated in her honor, so the holiday is the patronal feast. A solemn all-night vigil was supposed to be served in the small church today. The parish schedule indicates that the start of the service, which takes about two hours, is at 18:00. However, the service is now being hastily moved to an earlier time, since by 19:00 no one should remain on the territory of the temple complex.

@christianvision Source channel: test_source

-1002328631739.html:
"Dying Russian soldiers are holding back the coming of the Antichrist" - Bishop Pitirim (Tvorogov)

Bishop Pitirim (Tvorogov) of Skopin in an interview on the topic of the military and spiritual life directly stated that Ukraine as a state does not exist: "Both are Russians. They just called themselves Ukrainians." According to him, Russia is the "House of God" from which the "judgment over humanity" is to begin, and it is from here, allegedly, that the battle with the "collective Antichrist" should begin.

Justifying the Russian invasion, Pitirim refers to the Battle of Kulikovo and the figure of Sergius of Radonezh. He claims that the latter blessed Dmitry Donskoy "to fight Islamization," and today the church is also blessing the special military operation as a "spiritual war" for Orthodox Rus'. According to him, the death of Russian soldiers at the front "postpones the coming of the Antichrist," and those who are fighting are allegedly already "ready for eternal life" and "pray more strongly than in churches."

"Every battle, every death of our fighter or even a wound, a mutilation - this is every desperate cry, yes, - it all postpones the coming of the Antichrist for one second, for a minute, for an hour. That's who they are - they are the warriors of the Apocalypse."

The bishop contrasts the fighting men with "peaceful" women, who, according to him, "went to psychics and fortune tellers three times more often" instead of going to churches. He links the failures at the front with the sins within the country - abortions, LGBTQ, witchcraft. In his opinion, victory is possible only with "legislative struggle against evil" - up to the ban on magic and strict control over spiritual life.

#russia #roc Source channel: Christians Against War!

A criminal case has been initiated in the Nizhny Novgorod region for transfers to the Ukrainian center of Muntyan

In the Balakhna district, a criminal case has been initiated against a local resident who is suspected of financing the "All-Ukrainian Spiritual Center "Vozrozhdenie" of Vladimir Muntyan. The investigation claims that the woman transferred funds to support the organization, knowing in advance that its activities are recognized as undesirable on the territory of Russia.

The case is classified under Part 2 of Article 284.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation - providing funds for an "undesirable organization". The suspect has been placed under a travel restriction order.

üì∑: Investigative Committee of the Nizhny Novgorod region

#russia #protestants Source channel: Christians against the war!

-1002428139436.html:
Journalist and Catholic believer from Polotsk, Tina Palynska, has stopped communicating.

Journalist and Catholic believer from Polotsk, Tina Palynska, has not been in contact since the end of May - she was likely detained and then possibly arrested as part of a criminal case.

Tina's acquaintances do not yet know the details. She was last seen online on May 19.

Tina has long since stopped working as a journalist, raising her daughters, working in archives, including Russian ones, fulfilling private orders for creating biographical essays, family books, and stories about World War II participants.

Earlier, in 2022, the journalist was fined under an administrative article for yellow and blue ribbons on her bag, and the Investigative Committee conducted an investigation into her Facebook post and conducted a search of the journalist's home.

@christianvision Source channel: Christian Vision: NO TO WAR!

The resources of the political prisoner Christian Nikolai Dedok have been recognized as "extremist materials"

On May 29, 2025, the court of the Central District of Minsk recognized the website and social media pages associated with the political prisoner Nikolai Dedok as "extremist materials". The list includes:

‚ñ™Ô∏è website: https://mikola.noblogs.org/
‚ñ™Ô∏è VKontakte page: https://vk.com/mikola_dziadok
‚ñ™Ô∏è Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/happymikola
‚ñ™Ô∏è Instagram account: https://www.instagram.com/Mikola_dziadok

Nikolai Alexandrovich Dedok is a Christian and anarchist, born on August 23, 1988. He was arrested in November 2020 on several articles, including Art. 342, 361 and 295-3 of the Criminal Code of the Republic of Belarus, and sentenced to 5 years in a general regime colony. He was subjected to torture.

Source channel: Christian Vision: NO TO WAR!

Tina Palynska and her 22-year-old daughter are in custody - likely in connection with the "Belarusian Analytical Workshop"

As reported earlier by Christian Vision, journalist and Catholic believer from Polotsk Tina Palynska has been out of contact since the end of May. It was then assumed that she could have been detained.

Now, as Katolik.life has learned, Tina Palynska and her elder daughter Margarita, 22 years old, are in custody on a criminal case. The women are being held in Pre-Trial Detention Center No. 2 in Vitebsk. Tina also has a younger underage daughter - she is 14 years old.

The details of the accusation are not officially disclosed. Based on indirect signs, there is an assumption that the case may be related to the KGB's decision to recognize the "Belarusian Analytical Workshop" of Professor Andrey Vardomatsky as an extremist formation. This organization conducted sociological surveys among Belarusian citizens. There is information about searches and seizure of equipment from other people who were interviewed as part of the workshop's sociological research.

At the moment, there is no confirmation that Tina or her daughter actually participated in the BAW research. But even if such participation took place, it would not have violated the law: at the time of the possible contact with the workshop, it had not yet been recognized as an extremist formation. The KGB's decision is dated May 16, 2025, published - May 21. Already on May 22, the ONT TV channel aired an "exposing" story about the activities of the workshop.

@christianvision Source channel: Christian Vision: NO TO WAR!

Today begins the visit to Belarus of the Moscow Patriarch Kirill

The visit is timed to coincide with the 900th anniversary of the Savior-Euphrosyne Convent in the city of Polotsk.

It is planned that today, June 4, at 4:30 pm in the Minsk Holy Spirit Cathedral, and after that Patriarch Kirill will go to the Joy-Sorrowful parish in Minsk to inspect the completed co-cathedral. Unprecedented security measures are being taken for the visit of the head of the Russian Orthodox Church, including personal belongings checks and selective phone checks.

Those wishing to attend the services are also advised to take precautions - not to take mobile phones with them, unsubscribe from all potentially extremist channels, clear the search history in Google, etc.
